channel.title: Hello
channel.description:
Hey i'm new to the forums, I really enjoy linux, I have ubuntu, although i have only had it maybe a week, and i'm interested in learning more about it,
Whats different from kbuntu and ubuntu? I know that ones KDE and one is GNOME, but i don't really know the difference.

item.title: Hello
item.dc:creator: @Aaronnn1 Aaronnn`
item.description:
@Aaronnn1 wrote:

I still cant get KDE to work ;[

It says kconfig startup4 or something along those lines is missing or messed up.
Any Advice? :o

I have already removed it and tried installing again. same problem, should i write it to a disk and install?

It says Kstartupconfig 4 does not exist or fails. The error code is 3.

EDIT" found a solution, I like them both alot hard choice.

Read full topic

item.title: Hello
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Aaronnn`:

i didn’t know you had to log out and select KDE or GNOME. ><

At least you figured it out by yourself. So what do you think? Which do you prefer?

Read full topic

item.title: Hello
item.dc:creator: @Aaronnn1 Aaronnn`
item.description:
@Aaronnn1 wrote:

I already have ubuntu installed, and i just installed kubuntu-desktop, and i see no diffrents really, just a new booting screen and new programs.

Lol, nevermind i didn’t know you had to log out and select KDE or GNOME. ><

Read full topic

item.title: Hello
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

The best way to tell the difference is to install the packages kubuntu-desktop and ubuntu-desktop, and then log into each one to see which you like better. You don’t have to re-install anything at all, just choose KDE or Gnome when you go to log into it.

Read full topic
